lexUnit.name: roll.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: move by turning over and over on an axis.

sentence.text: She missed the next ball , which rolled toward the lounge .
United 's goalkeeper Brian O'Shea reacted brilliantly to block the shot but the ball rolled straight into the path of Coyle who drilled a right foot volley into the back of the net .
Fred Barber got a hand to the midfielder 's effort , and with the ball rolling towards the empty net , Gaughan 's former Doncaster team-mate Ronnie Robinson slid the ball off the line .
As a child I made these , covering the kitchen in ingredients and allowing balls of mixture to roll all over the place , only to be found six months later behind the toaster .
Neither moneychangers , nor bystanders , nor Jesus 's own followers are likely to have stood idle , or engaged in theological debate , while loose coins rolled in all directions .
Then he was falling , slipping , tumbling over and over , rolling into an abyss he had n't realised was there .
Their movement dislodged a stone beer jar that rolled into a small depression and began glug-glugging its contents into the soil .
Visualise your tee shot splitting the fairway and rolling into the perfect position .
Davis himself was the first to notice the mist that rolled towards them .
The fog rolled across the fields , obliterating everything in its path with a flannel-like opacity .
It came rolling towards us from the west .
It fell on the floor and rolled towards Uncle Mick 's feet -- and he promptly stood on it with all his forty-year police authority and his size ten boots .
It rolled to the back of the green and was still outside Buck .
I plugged my naked feet in between the empty seats as tears rolled down my cheeks .
Suddenly it slipped from his hand and rolled down the bank into the water .
Juice rolled down his chin .
If you putt the ball , you can hit it firmly to the top of the bank and simply let it roll down to the hole .
` The body rolled down the slope into the water .
Mr Samson , in the Barnard Castle-based 223 Field Ambulance Unit , threw a grenade from a trench but it bounced off a wall , rolled back and exploded just six feet away .
From being surprised that a ball rolls away on a gentle slope , a child will purposely ride his scooter down the same slope for enjoyment , knowing that he then has to push it up again .
A small lump of nothing rolled across the floor , gathering substance , and coalesced into an unnoticed rat .
Tears rolling along her cheeks , Nicandra felt that Maman was now far more angry with Dada and Aunt Tossie than with her .
When one rolled along the ground he picked it up and stood it on its end to stop it rolling .
A moment later gold coins were rolling across the floor , spinning , glittering .
The fog rolled across the fields , obliterating everything in its path with a flannel-like opacity .
A trickle of sweat rolled down the side of Tom 's face .
It rolled along the road coming to rest at the edge of the headlight beam .
There was a sudden bang as he crashed against the Lift , and a scraping sensation as he began to roll along the surface .
I think we should now talk of heads rolling along the Potomac .
What he saw were two mighty puffs of orange-red smoke billowing and rolling through the trees in his direction .
EGGS galore rolled across the playground at Camelsdale School last week when the children took part in a traditional Easter egg-rolling .
He was working on a building site at Middle Barton in North Oxfordshire when a concrete mixer rolled back toward a workman .
